page.title: 09Transport
page.content: In the 1981 census there were 47 housholds out of a total of 174 who did not own cars. There is no public service by Eastern Counties Buses, but Caroline Coaches, a local private firm, run a school bus every day during term time, and a bus service to and from Yarmouth twice a day on Wednesday and Saturday. There is also a service to Norwich on a Friday. There is no train service but different Norwich to Yarmouth lines run through Acle and Reedham. There is no taxi service operating from the village. Private transport predominates. There is an airport in Norwich.
